newsitem.title: USA: John Harland sees Q1 below estimates.
newsitem.headline: John Harland sees Q1 below estimates.

text.p: John H. Harland Co said on Wednesday it expects first quarter earnings as much as $0.12 per share below analysts' expectations as it is experiencing higher than anticipated transition costs due to the reengineering of its printing infrastructure.
Current analysts' consensus is $0.33 per share, excluding additional severance costs related to the previously announced restructuring, the company said.

In order to ensure a smooth transition and high levels of service and quality, increased expenses are being incurred as new operations are being brought on line prior to closing those being consolidated, the company said.
